news.summary: In more wayt than one, Primal Scream were white hot at All Together Now!

news.title: All Together Now: The Boomtown Rats steal the show on Sunday
news.summary: Nelly Furtado was a fine closing act – but it was Bob Geldof and the gang who  grabbed the occasion by the scruff of the neck, to reclaim their place at the forefront of Irish rock...

news.title: Nelly Furtado at All Together Now (Photos)
news.summary: As the closing act, the Canadian star delivered an exhilarating performance...

news.title: Gareth Sheridan on the presidential race: “Michael D. did a great job commemorating our first 100 years. Someone needs to do an excellent job getting the next 100 started”
news.summary: Read the full interview in the current issue of Hot Press

news.title: Aziya: When I was kid, there weren’t many young women of colour making alternative music, but now there’s loads. We’re all trying to create a world where that’s the norm"
news.summary: Part of a new wave of female artists who are killing it in the UK, Aziya also stunned last month at the Mallorca Live Festival where talked punk heroes A-List admirers, the BRIT school, modelling adventures and wild London nights out with a Factor 50-slathered Stuart Clark.

news.title: Oasis in '95: "It might seem that we’re a bunch of ramshackle pissed-up drug addicts but we’re actually pretty organised and when things get done, they get done well"
news.summary: Ahead of Oasis’s sold-out Croke Park shows on August 16 & 17, we’re taking a deep-dive into the Hot Press archives – to hear Liam and Noel's incredible story in their own words...
